2.1.9.1.2. xml_compare.compare¶

xml_compare.compare(xml_first, xml_second)¶

Compare two XML files. Raise CompareError if comparison fails.

Parameters:
  • xml_first (Open file object | string) – Open file or filename of XML document that is known to be correct.
  • xml_second (Open file object | string) – Open file or filename of XML document to be checked against xml_first.
Returns:

None or raises CompareError.
Returns type:

None | Exception

Using xml_first to determine the requirements for xml_second, this checks the following in xml_second:

  • All elements are present.
  • All elements are in the same order.
  • All attributes are present.
  • All attributes contain the correct values.
  • All element text values are present.
  • All element text values are the same.

This does NOT check if there is any information present in xml_second that does not exist in xml_first.

TODO: Include test for tails. Skipped for now because tails are not used in any D1 types.
